I will then use the execute_shell command to make a GET request to the website of the hiking trail and extract the necessary information about the trail using the "grep" and "awk" commands. Finally, I will use the execute_python_file command to run the Python file that uses the Google Maps API to calculate the distance and travel time to the hiking trail.'}, 'command': {'name': 'execute_python_code', 'args': {'code': 'import googlemaps
from datetime import datetime

# Define the API key
API_KEY = 'YOUR_API_KEY'

# Define the client
gmaps = googlemaps.Client(key=API_KEY)

# Define the start and end points
start = "Yellowstone National Park"
end = "Mount Washburn"

# Define the mode of transportation
mode = "driving"

# Define the departure time
departure_time = datetime.now()

# Get the directions
directions = gmaps.directions(start, end, mode=mode, departure_time=departure_time)

# Get the distance and travel time
distance = directions[0]['legs'][0]['distance']['text']
travel_time = directions[0]['legs'][0]['duration']['text']

# Print the distance and travel time
print("Distance: {}".format(distance))
print("Travel Time: {}".format(travel_time))
'}, 'name': 'calculate_distance.py'}}
